editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: JOHN OF DAMASCUS, BOETHIUS, GUNDISSALINUS; S. XIV1

msItem.note: On fol. i is a list of contents, s. xiv, and faint pencil notes; fol. iv blank; on fol. 1rv is a list of quaestiones in pencil, the last ascr. ‘fr(ater) Hugo’. On fol. 1v are two lists of contents, one s. xv, the other s. xvi ex.

msItem.author: JOHN OF DAMASCUS
msItem.title: De Fide Orthodoxa
msItem.rubric: Iohannis presbiteri Damasceni in quo est tradicio certa ortodoxa fidei c. diuersa c. a Burgundione iudice ciue Pisano de Greco in Latinum domino iii. Eugenio beate memorie pape translatus ...
msItem.explicit: idque ab ipso est gaudium fructificantes amen.
msItem.note: ed. E. M. Buytaert (St Bonaventure, NY, 1955). Followed by capitula on fol. 49rv. Annotated in early anglicana hands.

msItem.author: JOHN OF DAMASCUS
msItem.title: Logica
msItem.incipit: Sermo de philocosmis id est amatoribus mundi
Quemadmodum dulce philocosmis existit sensibilium paradisorum
msItem.explicit: est custodiens inconfusum et inuertibile. Explicit.

msItem.author: JOHN OF DAMASCUS
msItem.title: Elementarium Dogmatum
msItem.rubric: Introductio docmatum elementarum a uoce S. Iohannis Damasceni ad Iohannem sanctissimum episcopum Laodicie.
msItem.incipit: In nomine Patris ... Que sit intencio Damasceni in hoc libro. Substancia et natura et forma secundum sanctos patres idem est
msItem.explicit: semper cum ipso esse et frui ipsius gloria et regno nunc et semper et in s. s. amen. Explicit.

msItem.author: JOHN OF DAMASCUS
msItem.title: De Hymno Trisagion
msItem.rubric: Epistola scripta ad Iordanem archimandritam de trisagio.
msItem.incipit: Dei honoracio et zelo diuino ornato
msItem.note: CPG8049, ed. M. Holland, PhD diss. (Harvard University, 1980); Thomson, Grosseteste, p. 51; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 547–8.

msItem.author: BOETHIUS
msItem.title: Opuscula Sacra

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in librum Boecii de unitate Trinitatis ad Symacum.
msItem.incipit: Domino patri Symaco de trinitate Boecius. Inuestigatam a nobis diutissime

msItem.rubric: (fol. 90) Hic incipit quedam questio Boecii ad Iohannem ecclesie Romane diaconem utrum Pater et Filius et Spiritus Sanctus predicentur substantialiter de natura diuina.
msItem.incipit: Quero an Pater et Filius et Spiritus Sanctus de diuinitate substantialiter predicentur

msItem.rubric: (fol. 90v) Anicii Mallii Seuerini Boecii exconsulis ordinarii patricii de ebdomatibus liber incipit.
msItem.incipit: Postulas ut ex ebdomatibus nostris est questionis obscuritatem

msItem.rubric: (fol. 92) Incipit liber Boecii contra Euthicem et Nestorium.
msItem.incipit: Xristiani fidem noui ac ueteris testamenti pandit autoritas

msItem.rubric: (fol. 94) Incipit prologus in libro Boecii de duabus naturis et una persona Christi ad Iohannem romane ecclesie subdyaconem.
msItem.incipit: Domino sancto ... Anxie te quidem sustinui

msItem.note: CPL 890–4; ed. and transl. H. F. Stewart and E. K. Rand (London, 1918 / 1973).

msItem.author: DOMINICUS GUNDISSALINUS
msItem.title: De Vnitate et Vno.
msItem.incipit: Vnitas est qua unaqueque res una esse dicitur
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de unitate et uno qui a quibusdam dicitur esse Boecii.
msItem.note: fol. 102b is filled with a draft sermon in a hand of s. xv. On the verso are faint pencil notes. fol. 103rv blank.

supportDesc.extent:
104 leaves (i + 103) 255 175
200 125
The edges retrimmed, affecting running heads and marginalia, and spattered with red.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 45 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single low-grade English gothic rotunda bookhand. The scribe provides running heads and corrects his work in the margins.

decoDesc.decoNote: None: unfilled spaces for painted initials and rubrics.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The first and last leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding, which was sewn on five bands.

history.provenance: Across the head of fol. 2 is ‘Liber domus scolarium de Mertone in Oxonia ex legato M. Iohannis Reynham sacre pagine professoris et quondam socii eiusdem domus’. For Reynham, fellow 1335–58, see MS 18.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii.
On the board itself is ‘O. 4. 1. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘H. 1. 1 (CXLV)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 62; Powicke, no. 353; Codices Boethiani, no. 223.
